ygData.messageBody:
I am seeing different results from arrows... This might or might not help.
I need to do more testing with some of the 2 through 8 Damage arrows though.
I primarily use the 1 Dam 150 Range arrows, and am a L33 Warrior using the
Compound Darkwood - 19 Damage one. I see a maximum currently of 26 points
of damage from my arrows, and hit quite often for 23, 24 and 25. This is
the most that I have ever seen, and while I see it more often the lower the
"Con" of the MOB, I do occaisionally see it versus RED's and YELLOW's. I do
plan on making up a few hundred 2 Damage Arrows and firing them for an
extended period of time to get a maximum on them too..

I do agree with you though on the arrow cost far out weighing the damage
that they give. But at the same time I plan on testing more with higher
damage arrows to see how much more damage they actually do yeild.

I will keep you posted on my results.

A tip here for you fletcher / archers.... Carry the components to make
arrows with you to fletch as you go on the road. The components to make 100
arrows only take up 4 slots unfletched, and 5 slots fletched. I normally
fill up (2) 8 Slot containers for a good hunt and supply arrows to the
others in my party that use them... Of course I use my bow as a weapon too
so I go through a lot of arrows on a hunt. When pulling, I normally back up
to the ambush sight pumping arrows into it as I go, and can have a couple of
hundred points in it as it arrives. Also if I am not pulling, tell the
puller to hit auto-attack as they say "INC" and you can use the /assist
command to get a target on the MOB, then flip off your auto-attack as it
turns on and shoot it as the puller brings it in. Takes some coordination,
but works pretty well. Lastly, if you have to back out of combat because
you are hurt, flip off the auto-attack, back off a few feet, and fire into
the melee with arrows. This works great for any warriors and rogues, and
the hybirds that are low on mana or want to save their mana for later.

As you can see, I am not one of those types that would say "I only use it to
pull" when talking about my bow.

From: Mark Pribe [mailto:mpribe@...]

To: EQ_Fletchers@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [EQ_Fletchers] Digest Number 34


>> Unless Verant does something a bit different about arrows, there's
not much sense in making (in my opinion) anything beyond a damage 1 arrow
unless someone specifically asks for you better and is willing to pay for it
(which happens very rarely).
>> Now, the sensible thing, it would seem...is to make arrow damage a
multiplier of bow damage...given that arrow cost basically doubles for each
additional damage point. Otherwise, it's simply not cost efficient to use
them.
>> With the present system, bow damage + arrow damage = total damage.
A damage 1 arrow costs, say 1sp, and adds 1 damage to your 19 damage bow for
a total of 20 damage max. A damage 2 arrow costs 2sp and adds 2 damage to
your 19 damage bow for a total of 21 damage max.
>> For the 2sp I spent on a 2 damage arrow doing 21 max damage, I
could have made two 1 damage arrows with a total damage potential of 40.
>> And of course, it gets worse the higher you go...spend 8sp on one
4 damage arrow with a total potential damage of 23, or 8sp on eight 1 damage
arrows with a total potential damage of 160?
>> This of course, discounts crits, but those are not significantly
higher to the point of justifying the ridiculous cost.
>> The other sensible change would be to simply adjust the cost of
making the arrows more in line with their actual value.
>> If Verant is really interested in making fletching a viable trade,
(bowyering is) they need to make one of these adjustments, and I heartily
encourage my fellows to join me in suggesting a change.
